ovdesc.p: From this table the user should use the facility of translating into the various languages defined on the LANGUAGE table:
o all the fields in each record application.
o all the various error messages existing within the various applications of T24.
o Various general system messages not included in the list of 'GLOBAL.TEXT' from the STATIC.TEXT facility. Such messages will include Text such as

For each language existing on the LANGUAGE table, the user will have the facility to enter the applicable translations. It must be noted immediately that, for performance reasons, the English translation of the messages entered in the first field (TEXT 1) will be ignored by the system. The English text of the messages will be taken directly from the program. Translation of messages in other languages will be recognised and used in accordance with the language code defined in the corresponding user profile.

desc.p: Identifies the second language text field which allows the user to enter the translation text in the language specified in the 3 dots preceding the literal 'TEXT'. (...Text).
It must be remembered that the English translation (text 1) will be ignored by the Transaction processing Application. This is strictly for performance reasons.
2 to 35 alphanumeric characters. Mandatory input.
Translation is only allowed if language '2' exists on the LANGUAGE table.

Identifies the key by which access can be gained to the DYNAMIC.TEXT table. Input should correspond to an existing message within T24.
Although the system does not force it, meaningful input should correspond to a valid Error Message or existing system message, which the user wants to translate in various languages.

New DYNAMIC.TEXT records may be created in EB.ERROR and OVERRIDE when a second language is multi valued and committed, the data in the first multi value language field e.g. GB will act as the ID in DYNAMIC.TEXT and the text fields in the record will be populated according to the language fields in EB.ERROR and OVERRIDE.
